summary: Internal email chain among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing a CBS inquiry about a DOJ investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death. Nicolas Roos clarifies that a DOJ-OIG investigation into institutional failures surrounding the death has been ongoing since Epstein died, and is not a new or 'reopened' case.

persons.name: Nicolas Roos
persons.context: Author of an email clarifying the status of the DOJ-OIG investigation into Epstein's death, stating it has been ongoing since the day Epstein died and focuses on institutional failures.

persons.name: James Margolin
persons.context: Forwarded an inquiry from a CBS contact claiming a 'highly placed source' said the DOJ had 'reopened' the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Rebekah Donaleski
persons.context: Listed as a recipient of the initial email from James Margolin regarding the CBS inquiry about Epstein's death investigation.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.context: Copied on the initial email from James Margolin regarding the CBS inquiry about Epstein's death investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: Subject of the email discussion; his death and the ongoing DOJ-OIG investigation into institutional failures surrounding it are the central topics.

connections.description: Communicating within the same office (U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY) about a media inquiry regarding Epstein's death.
Margolin sends an email to Donaleski (and others) to forward a media inquiry.
Margolin copies Biase on an email regarding a media inquiry about Epstein's death.
Roos, as part of the U.S. Attorney's Office, is providing information about the ongoing investigation into the circumstances of Epstein's death.

events.title: DOJ-OIG Investigation into Epstein's Death
events.description: An ongoing investigation by the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General focusing on institutional failures surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

events.title: CBS Media Inquiry
events.description: A person at CBS contacts the U.S. Attorney's Office claiming a 'highly placed source' says the DOJ has 'reopened' the investigation into Epstein's death, suggesting doubts about the suicide ruling.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY (Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: As of September 2021, a DOJ-OIG investigation into institutional failures surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death was still ongoing and had been since the day he died.

A CBS reporter contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office with a claim from a 'highly placed source' that the DOJ had 'reopened' the investigation into Epstein's death, implying someone was not convinced it was a suicide.
SDNY staffer Nicolas Roos clarified that the investigation was not new or 'reopened,' but a slow-moving, pre-existing inquiry into institutional failures.
The email indicates internal coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) to manage media inquiries and maintain a consistent message regarding the Epstein death investigation.
